Question
========
  
The mean in a sample of 25 persons is 15, the variance is 9. 

Calculate the 95% confidence interval for the population mean.
  
Answerlist
----------
* 13.82 ; 16.18
* 13.76 ; 16.24
* 11.28 ; 18.72
* 14.75 ; 15.25

Solution
========

$95 \% \; CI: \; mean \pm t._{025} \times se$

So, firstly you have to find the corresponding *t*-value and calculate the standard error.

*t*-value at $df = n-1 = 25-1 = 24: \; 2.064$

$se = \frac{s}{\sqrt{n}} = \frac{3}{5} = 0.6$

When you fill this in, you get: $15 \pm 2.064 \times 0.6$, which is $13.76 \; ; \; 16.24$.

Answerlist
----------
* Incorrect
* Correct
* Incorrect
* Incorrect
